page.title: 01Tickencote Village.
page.content: Tickencote village lies north of Stamford and east of the A1. It is a very attractive residential site, whose claim to fame is the unique Norman Chancel Arch. Originally the inhabitants were estate workers. The Lords of te Manor were the{Wingfields}- whoe were distantly related to the{Cromwells.} During the 1938-45 war the Hall was used by H.M. Forces, and was pulled down later. The present Hall was made from outbuildings, etc.. Even the mill - by the{River Gwash}- has been made into a private residence: likewise the school. The original inn - The Flower Pot - is also a private dwelling. There are{no}shops. The whole area is devoted to agriculture - mainly mixed farming.
